column3: A box shows up labeled “emotional support noodles.” This night you will sleep with a full belly. Thanks mom!
You find a blazer that makes you look like a respected genius (or a magician). Either way: confidence.
At 1:07am, your brain goes full fireworks. The muse arrives late, but brings snacks.
You cook one enormous thing and live off it like a raccoon with a meal plan.
You help carry a couch up three flights. In exchange: pizza and a story you’ll tell forever.
You become a DIY legend for exactly nine minutes.
The librarian recognizes you. Your power level doubles. Quietly.
Your friends gas you up with unearned confidence and 37 messages in a row.
You find $12 and instantly become a financial genius.
A mug of tea and Wi-Fi password turn you into a disciplined monk.
You visit every Costco within a hundred square miles and take free samples until they cut you off.
You do laundry, reply to one email, and go out to hang with friends. All in one day.
Granny tells you you’re brilliant and also that you look tired. At least one of those is true.
You find your old notebook. Past-you was secretly hilarious. Future-you is grateful.
All your favorite productivity songs back to back for hours.
Suddenly everything tastes like a cooking show. You are the host now.
You meet someone cool between Spin Cycle #3 and the sock abyss.
You stack coupons like a sorcerer. The cashier bows.

column2: Sunlight Hits Your Desk Just Right
column3: For ten glorious minutes your workspace looks like an indie film poster.
Your back cracks like a drum fill. Your brain immediately forgives you.
You open the fridge and something opens its eyes back. You lose your appetite — and your peace.
Your landlord texts “Hey :)” and your soul leaves your body.
A friend drops off leftovers like a benevolent food fairy.
You clean your space, light a candle, and declare your living room a sacred studio.
